creditline: Gift of Leo A. and Doris Hodroff
description: four-case inrō; fundame decorated in hiramaki-e with leaping karashishi holding peony flower in mouth; reverse with another shishi on gold ground; glass bead ojime; ivory netsuke of herb gatherer drowsing beside basket with flowers and sickle; attached with brown, braided, silk cord through inro and ties at bottom
medium: Lacquer (hiramaki-e); ojime: glass; netsuke: ivory; silk cord
title: Four-case inro with decor of Chinese lions catching peonies; netsuke of herb gatherer
